intro: Ochrothallus gordoniifolius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of violet, pink, and white, are pollinated by various insects, including bees and butterflies. Ochrothallus gordoniifolius is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
